document.title: Battery Collecting
document.chapo: Procedente igitur mox tempore cum adventicium nihil inveniretur, relicta ora maritima in Lycaoniam adnexam Isauriae se contulerunt ibique densis intersaepientes itinera praetenturis provincialium et viatorum opibus pascebantur.
document.content: According to a report [1], vendors sold more than 507 millions batteries in California in 2001: only 0.55% of these batteries were recycled. When not recyclyed, a single battery will pollute 35 cubic foot and 265 gallons of water for 50 years. The battery contains heavy metal like Lead, Mercury, Aluminum or Lithium [2]. They are well-known to accumulate into living being, their body concentration increasing while climbing up the chain food, which ultimately ends inside our bodies.
